revised_title: Hamilton Hartridge: A Life Dedicated to Science and Engineering
tldr: Hamilton Hartridge was a renowned eye physiologist and inventor, born in 1886. He was known for his mechanical inventions and his contributions to the field of eye physiology. Hartridge studied at King's College, Cambridge, and held various positions in the field of physiology throughout his career. He was also involved in the development of the Airship Construction Station during World War I and later became the first Director of the Medical Research Council's Unit in the Institute of Ophthalmology. Hartridge's life was dedicated to science, engineering, and his family.
